meanings.definition: To remove from a seat or position of authority.
meanings.sent1: The teacher unseated the student council president for breaking the rules.
meanings.sent2: She unseated the king and took his place on the throne.
meanings.sent3: The cat unseated the dog as the ruler of the house.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news unseated the CEO from his comfortable position.
meanings.sent5: The challenger unseated the champion with a surprising victory.

meanings.definition: To cause to fall from a seat or position.
meanings.sent1: The sudden stop unseated the passengers on the bus.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind unseated the umbrella from its stand.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy unseated the toddler from his high chair.
meanings.sent4: The earthquake unseated the statue from its pedestal.
meanings.sent5: The jolt unseated the rider from the horse.

meanings.definition: To dislodge or displace from a seat or position.
meanings.sent1: The storm unseated the boat captain from his place at the helm.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake unseated the books from the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel unseated the bird feeder from the tree.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news unseated the politician from his position of power.
meanings.sent5: The forceful impact unseated the door from its hinges.
